Class Railgun

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Polygon
      • Railgun
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.Shape, java.io.Serializable

    public class Railgun
extends java.awt.Polygon
    Contains all of the properties for the railgun, extending the Polygon class.
    Since:
    9/20/2018
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Modifier and Type Field and Description

      private boolean onScreen

      private int railgunWidth 
      static int[] railgunXPoints
      An int Array that holds the x and y coordinates for the Polygon construction of each bullet.

      An int Array that holds the x and y coordinates for the Polygon construction of each bullet.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Railgun(double xCenter, double yCenter, double flyingAngle)
      Constructs the railgun bullet via Polygon constructor, using the railguns coordinates and ships flying angle.

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Moves the overall x-position of the railgun.

      Gets the angle of the railgun bullet while its moving.

      double getYVelocity() 
      void move()
      Allows the railgun bullet to travel across If the railguns bullet goes over the edge, it will not be seen.
      double railgunXFlyingAngle(double xFlyingAngle)
      Gets the x-coordinate of the railguns flying angle, and converts it into radians so it can be used.
      double railgunYFlyingAngle(double yFlyingAngle)
      Gets the y-coordinate of the railguns flying angle, and converts it into radians so it can be used.
      java.awt.Rectangle setBounds()
      Creates a rectangle that is used for collision detection.

      Changes the visibility of the railgun on screen.

      Sets the x-coordinate center of the railgun.

      Sets the x-direction velocity of the railgun.
